eventName: A Light in the Dust: Solidarity for Afghanistan's Recovery - Advocacy Campaign
alt: Students volunteering for an advocacy campaign, A Light in the Dust: Solidary for Afghanistan's Recovery
descriptions: We advocated for the awareness and solidarity for families and children affected by the crisis in Afghanistan. Our team shared information with the SFU community, sparked conversations, and encouraged compassion and empathy on campus.

alt: Ambassadors and general members presenting for The Weight of Hunger event
descriptions: This internal event focussed on educating and advocating for the effects of malnutrition on children around the world. We also collected non-perishable food items for donation to the Salvation Army.

alt: Some of our executives presenting for the Behind the Seams event
descriptions: The internals team organized an event that advocated for the awareness and prevention of child labour and how we can make a difference through our consumption choices. The event also featured a clothing drive for Big Brothers of Greater Vancouver.

eventName: For every bite, a better life: a Krispy Kreme Fundraiser
alt: Our ambassadors volunteering for our Krispy Kreme Fundraiser
descriptions: Our fundraiser advocated for children's rights to survive and thrive around the world.

alt: Executives and general members at our first event of the Fall 2025 semester
descriptions: Our icebreaker event welcomed general members and helped everyone connect through fun games. They also got to know more about our UNICEF SFU and how they can get involved.

alt: Guests of UNICEF SFU's Bright Futures Gala in 2025
descriptions: The Bright Futures Gala was one of UNICEF SFU's annual charity galas that took place in March 2025, focussing on Child Protection and Inclusion, which is one of UNICEF's key global focus areas. The event brought together over 120 attendees for an inspiring evening dedicated to advocating for the safety, inclusion, and empowerment of every child. We were honoured to welcome best-selling author and educator Hannah Beach as our keynote speaker, whose work in social-emotional learning resonated deeply with the evening's message.
The event also raised over $3,300 in donations, with 100% of proceeds directly contributed to UNICEF Canada to support programs that protect children from violence, exploitation, and discrimination.

alt: Student volunteers with collected bottles for the Halloween Bottle Drive in Fall 2024
descriptions: In the Fall 2024 semester, our team got together to collect bottles from residences around our campus, raising over $500.

alt: Student volunteers for Hearts For Haiti advocacy campaign in Spring 2024
descriptions: In the Spring 2024 semester, UNICEF SFU launched their second advocacy campaign of the school year to raise awareness surrounding the children's humanitarian crisis in Haiti.
